snippet: A new paper says high-growth financial industries hurt the broader economy by dragging down overall growth and curbing productivity.
abstract: Gretchen Morgenson Fair Game column examines new evidence that high-growth financial sectors hurt the broader economy by dragging down overall growth and curbing productivity; observes that research comes amid intense debate over how big a role banking should play in the overall economy, and whether large banks like JPMorgan Chase would better serve the economy and shareholders if they were broken up.
lead_paragraph: A new paper says high-growth financial industries hurt the broader economy by dragging down overall growth and curbing productivity.
